lines.text: Point of view for observing motion
Katherine observes eraser moving horizontally and vertically
Speed of light in a vacuum

secText:
Lesson:
1. Define [OBJ:expsec_A463:reference frame].
2. Determine the [OBJ:expsec_A464:speed of light].
3. Calculate time elapsed of a moving clock as viewed by a stationary observer using [OBJ:expsec_A466:time dilation].
4. Calculate the length of a moving object as viewed by a stationary observer using [OBJ:expsec_A467:length contraction].
5. Define [OBJ:expsec_A469:Doppler effect].
6. Define and calculate observer frequency using the [OBJ:expsec_A410:Doppler light equation].

In-class assessment:
1. [OBJ:qc_37470:Calculate] the apparent dilation of time of a moving clock as viewed by a stationary observer.
2. [OBJ:qc_37471:Calculate] the apparent contraction of the length of a moving object as viewed by a stationary observer.
3. [OBJ:qc_37472:Calculate] the apparent shift in frequency of a light beam from space using the Doppler light equation.
Quick Review: [OBJ:sum_reference_c:Reference Frame and Speed of Light], [OBJ:sum_dilation:Time Dilation], [OBJ:sum_contraction:Length Contraction], [OBJ:sum_doppler_light:Light Doppler Shift]
